topic.title: Music Library Association Best Practices for extent of manifestation

div.div: Additional guidance for extent terms for specific types of audio recordings is provided in .

div.p: field 300 subfield $a. If deemed useful for identification or selection, provide additional clarifying information as an unstructured description in a 500 note.

For notated music resources consisting of multiple formats (e.g, score and parts), either record all units of extent in a single 300 field or as separate instances of the element in multiple 300 fields. If the units are of significantly different sizes, prefer separate 300 fields.
in field 300 in a shared cataloging environment; if needed, provide details in a Manifestation: instead.
in field 300 in a shared cataloging environment; if needed, provide details in a Manifestation: instead.
as a last recourse.

div.p: for notated music content. for audio files if readily ascertainable. Otherwise follow LC-PCC practice. under Format-Specific Guidance.
for notated music content. for audio files if readily ascertainable. Otherwise follow LC-PCC practice. under Format-Specific Guidance.

div.p: Also apply these instructions to notated music resources, unless contradicted by more specific instructions under Extent of manifestations of notated music.

section.title: Extent of manifestations of notated music

p.xref: Extent of manifestations of notated music

div.p: For manifestations consisting of one sheet or multiple sheets intended to be read as a single score or part, refer to the instructions at Single sheets or Two or more sheets respectively.

Do not use the word and to link scores and parts issued as physically distinct units. Instead, either record them together as a single value separated by a plus sign (+) and spaces, e.g. 1 score + 4 parts, or record the extent of each type of unit as a separate instance of the element. Follow the option for sets of parts and do not supply page count for parts. Otherwise record subunits as the option instructs.
Record multiple instances of the element in separate instances of field 300.
to scores issued with one or more parts as a single physical unit.

div.div: Additionally apply the instructions at Subunits in multiple unit manifestations if needed.

div.p: Note that applying this option in conjunction with these instructions on extent of notated music gives the construction 1 score (1 volume (unpaged)).

section.title: Pages, etc., numbered as part of a larger sequence

p.xref: Pages, etc., numbered as part of a larger sequence

div.p: Note that applying this option in conjunction with these instructions on extent of notated music gives a construction such as 1 score (1 volume (various pagings)).

section.title: Numbered leaves or pages of plates

p.xref: Numbered leaves or pages of plates

section.title: Unnumbered leaves or pages of plates

p.xref: Unnumbered leaves or pages of plates

div.p: Do not use the term sheet to describe extent of notated music resources. Instead record the number of subunits for notated music on a numbered single sheet as 1 leaf if only one side is numbered or as 2 pages if both sides are numbered. If the sheet is unnumbered, record the number of subunits as 1 unnumbered leaf if there is printing on one side or as 2 unnumbered pages if there is printing on both sides.
This restriction applies only to extent. The Manifestation: for a single sheet of notated music should still be recorded as sheet. Otherwise follow LC-PCC PS.

for notated music. Apply the instructions for volumes to a score, part, etc. issued as a folded sheet if the resource is intended to be read as consecutive pages. Record subunits in terms of leaves or pages.
Note that applying this option in conjunction with these instructions on extent of notated music gives a construction such as 1 score (2 volumes)).

for notated music. Apply the instructions for volumes to a score, part, etc. issued as two or more nested folded sheets, or one or more folded sheets with one or more unfolded sheets in the middle, if the resource is intended to be read as consecutive pages.

For loose unfolded sheets, record the number of subunits for notated music on numbered sheets in terms of leaves if only one side is numbered or pages if both sides are numbered. If the sheets are unnumbered, record the number of subunits in terms of unnumbered leaves if there is printing on one side or unnumbered pages if there is printing on both sides.
